Thanks a lot for this Aciaeiig, been looking for this for a while. I always loved the free version of the Nexus dock and always wanted to try out the ultimate version. 

To all those having trouble blocking this with the firewall, hope this will help:

After you install it and put the "xtreme.key" in the Licenses folder in Winstep (I also put the "file_id.diz" in there cause i didnt know what did lol)

The location for me on windows 7 64 bit was 
C:\Users\Public\Documents\Winstep\Licenses

then open up your firewall, just type in firewall in the start menu, and open up "Windows Firewall with Advanced Secuirty"

Your going to have to define new rules for all the .exe files associated with Winstep, not just the WinstepXtreme.exe file. I did this for only the one file, and it recognized it was a crack and locked me out. No biggie, just reinstall and do it again, but anyways i digress.

So go in the Outbound Rules on the left pane, and click "New Rule ..." way on the right pane. Then follow all the steps. There is a tutorial for how to do this on the web, i googled it and the first link that came up was a Microsoft one, which was the one i used. 
 Remember to this for all the .exe files, not just the WinstepXtreme one. I did this for the NexStart, Workshelf, and Key Manager (although im not really sure what that was) .exe files. I also did this same procedure for "Inbound Rules", as well, not really sure if that had an effect but the program has been working well for me for about a week now. 

Anywho, just thought I'd share some of my insight, hope it helped. 

Peace dawgs
